meanings.definition: To assign an incorrect value or worth to something.
meanings.sent1: She tends to misvalue her own skills and abilities, thinking she is not good enough.
meanings.sent2: It is easy to misvalue vintage items if you are not familiar with their true worth.
meanings.sent3: The magician's misvalue of the old hat led to a hilarious mix-up during the show.
meanings.sent4: Don't misvalue the importance of a kind gesture; it can make a big difference in someone's day.
meanings.sent5: The artist's misvalue of his painting caused him to sell it for much less than it was worth.

meanings.sent1: He tends to misvalue the effort required for completing the project on time.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to misvalue the impact of small acts of kindness on others.
meanings.sent3: The chef's misvalue of the spice level in the dish made it too spicy for anyone to eat.
meanings.sent4: Never misvalue the power of a sincere apology; it can mend relationships.
meanings.sent5: She misvalued the significance of the old photograph until she learned its historical importance.
